issue.description:
Page 16 section 4.2.4.3 Status The status of an approval is supposed to be "approved" or "not approved" according to the object description page 16 while page 176 proposes 4 approval status in the AIM: "approved", "not yet approved"; "disapproved" and "withdrawn".
Suggested solution: The text page 16 should be changed to be consistent with the AIM.
Page 23 section 4.2.19.4 Part_type The description of the possible part_types are not consistent with what is said page 153. In particular, the "customer supplied material" must be replaced by "customer furnished equipment"; and the part_type value "government" is not existing in the AIM rule of pages 152 and 153. Suggested solution Modify the text of the section 4.2.19.4 so that it is consistent with the authorized values in pages 152 and 153.
Page 36 section 4.3.23 Assertion from Product_configuration to Part. The assertion indicates a relationship from Product_configuration to Part while it should be from Product_configuration to Part_version.
Suggested solution: Change the assertion. The mapping table and the AIM are already reflecting the corrected assertion.
Page 54 mapping of Change date Date_time_role.name ='change_date' is not compliant with the rule 52 "restrict_date_time_role" page 186.
Suggested solution: Modify the role 'change_date' by 'start_date' in the mapping table to be consistent with the rule 52.
Page 75 mapping of standard_part_indicator The attribute related_product_category and relating_product_category have been replaced in the entity product_category_relationship by subcategory and category. Suggested solution: Modify attributes names in the mapping according to the part 41 definition.
Page 88 Rule 37 The name of the rule 37 is acu_requires_security_classification and not pdu_requires_security_classification as it is written.

comment.description:
This SEDS was raised against AP203 edition 1 and was closed in edition 2. 1. Approval status has been made generic, so the terms are not restricted to a particular set. 2. Part is now defined as a subtype of Product, so the mappings and values have changed accordingly 3. The mappings now reflect the new edition of Part41 4. The typo for the rule acu_requries_security_classification has been corrected.
The modules affected by this SEDs are:
Approval, part_and_version_identification, part_view_definition, and configuration_control_3d_design_ed2

description.p: (3) Paragraph: ISO/TS 10303-1022:2004 Part and version identification

The entity Part has the following rule: WR1: SIZEOF(['part', 'raw material']*types_of_product(SELF))=1; "WR1: The Part shall belong to a product category named 'part' or to a product category named 'raw material'. Whereas the Module says; "If the Part represents a non-countable material that is used as a component in an assembly, the Part shall be, in addition, referred to by a Product_category_assignment and the associated category shall have the name 'non-countable material'." 1) This indicates that the rules should refer to 'non-countable material', or the statement in the module is incorrect & should state 'raw material'. 2) It is not clear whther PLCS is handling raw or non - countable materials. If not, this aspect may be removed. 3) There should be a rule to say that the Part cannot be related to itself (through Product_category_hierarchy & PC Assignment).
